definition: to invite/to provoke/to demand or ask for/to send armed forces to suppress/to denounce or condemn/to marry (a woman)/to discuss or study

sentences.english: One debt collector in Spain uses public shaming a tool of coercion.
sentences.chinese: 一名西班牙討債者也正在使用公開羞辱作爲脅迫工具。

sentences.english: Thus, old Wan had to set foot on the road of debt collection on his own.
sentences.chinese: 於是，老宛獨自一人踏上了討債之路。

sentences.english: By September over 100 moneylenders were showing up at his premises every day demanding repayment.
sentences.chinese: 但到了9月，每天都有將近100多人蹲點向他討債。

sentences.english: Father of avoid dunning, no sign of drag more female debt collection harassment.
sentences.chinese: 欣父規避追債沒了蹤跡，拖累欣母倍受討債騷擾。

sentences.english: Creditors chasing the door by flesh, even the capital turnover are dubious.
sentences.chinese: 被債主追着上門討債，連資金週轉都成問題。

sentences.english: The company gave me dunning letters and calls.
sentences.chinese: 這家公司給我來了許多討債信和催債電話。

sentences.english: Andy spun out some drug list and quantity, cheat dunner.
sentences.chinese: 安迪胡編亂造出一些藥品名單和數量，騙住了討債人。

sentences.english: To demand money from a person who has just lost his job is hitting a man who is down.
sentences.chinese: 向一個剛剛失業的人討債等於落井下石。

definition: to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
to shift one's eyes/(fig.) to shift one's attention/to divert attention
to fight back/to return fire/to counterattack
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to procrastinate/to stall for time/to filibuster
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
variant of 誣衊|诬蔑[wu1 mie4]
to lament/to complain tearfully/to wail accusingly
